description: Proposed change of use from cabin sales to car sales. Retention of boundary treatment and sales office.
decision_conditions: This permission shall be for a limited period only and shall expire two years from the commencement of the development or expiring on 1st May 2022 on or before which date the uses hereby permitted shall be discontinued, the buildings and works carried out under this permission shall be removed and the site reinstated to its former condition to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority within 3 months of the expiry of the permission unless an application is submitted to extend the planning permission hereby approved.
Reason:
To ensure that the development is carried out in accordance to the approved scheme and that  enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
Reason:-
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.
All equipment associated with the car wash use shall be stored internally on-site when not in use.
Reason:-
In the interests of visual amenity, and that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policies DC45 and DC61.

Prior to the implementation of the use hereby approved except two buildings one to be used in associated with the proposed car sale and one for purposes all other buildings and structures shall be removed from the site and soft landscaping introduced in their place.
Reason:-
In the interests of visual amenity, and that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policies DC45 and DC61.

The car sales hereby approved shall not be commenced until details of the fencing is provided in accordance with details previously submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The fencing shall be implemented in accordance to the approved scheme and retained as such thereafter.
Reason:-

Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge the appropriateness of the fencing is this Green Belt location Submission of this detail prior to the car wash use will protect the visual amenity and the openness of the Green Belt and ensure that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policies DC45 and DC61.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) the uses hereby permitted shall be limited to the display and sale of private motor cars and a car wash only and shall be used for no other purpose(s) whatsoever including any use or sale of commercial vehicles, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:-

To restrict the use of the premises to ensure the application site would preserve the open character of the Green Belt and that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61and the advice given in the Revised NPPF 2019.
No power tools or machinery shall be used on the premises other than portable hand tools.
Reason:-

To minimise the impact of the development on the surrounding area in the interests of amenity, and that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

The premises shall not be used for the purposes hereby permitted other than between the hours of 0800 and 1800 on Mondays to Fridays and between 0900 and 1700 on Sundays, Bank or Public holidays without the prior consent in writing of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:-

To enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control in the interests of amenity, and in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

The car sales shall only be limited to the 27 car parking bays indicated on plans and there shall not be more than 27 cars on sale, unless an alternative scheme has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason:-

Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge the appropriateness of the fencing is this Green Belt location Submission of this detail prior to the car wash use will protect the visual amenity and the openness of the Green Belt and ensure that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policies DC45 and DC61.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.

Within two months from the scheme hereby approved a verification report shall be provided by a professional to provide evidence that the details of surface water drainage and attenuation/storage works as submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority has been fully implemented. If the report fails to indicate that appropriate measures has not been implemented then it would be likely that appropriate measure would be taken to ensure compliance with the condition.
